alert.note: Alert for Copiah; Jefferson Davis; Lawrence; Lincoln; Simpson; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 9:08PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of southeastern Simpson, Smith, northern Lincoln, northern Lawrence, southern Copiah and northwestern Jefferson Davis Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 906 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Pulaski to near Harrisville to near Caseyville. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Gusty showers will be near... Vaughn and Shivers around 920 PM CDT. Brookhaven, Wesson and Burns around 925 PM CDT. Sanatorium around 930 PM CDT. Pineville around 935 PM CDT. Magee and Clem around 940 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these gusty showers include Sylvarena, New Hebron, Mize, Silver Creek and Beauregard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. These winds may occur even before thunder is heard. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and southwestern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Copiah; Jefferson Davis; Lawrence; Lincoln; Simpson; Smith
